item.title: A random number generator in Bash
item.description: The bash environment variable ‘RANDOM’ is a pseudo-random number generator built in bash, and itÂ can generate random numbers in the range of 0 - 32767. Using the command `echo $RANDOM`, we can generate a random number. Building a random number generator which emits a sequence of random numbers is pretty easy. [code language=“bash”] #!/bin/bash for i in `seq 1 10`: do echo $RANDOM; sleep 1s; done [/code] The ‘seq’ or the ‘sequential’ can be used to generate a sequence of numbers.
